intro: Heberdenia bahamensis, commonly known as the Bahamian heberdenia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly the Bahamas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pale yellow to white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are palmately lobed, with a distinctive shape that aids in its identification. Heberdenia bahamensis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions.
